definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

sentences.english: The stability of the economy and society would surely be affected, leaving people haunted.
sentences.chinese: 轮番提价势必影响经济和社会稳定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: He put a well-reasoned case for increasing the prices.
sentences.chinese: 他提出了非常充分的提价理由。

sentences.english: Shops are no longer allowed to push up their prices whenever they want.
sentences.chinese: 再不允许商店想什么时候提价就提价了。

sentences.english: Shops are no longer allowed to push up their prices whenever they want.
sentences.chinese: 再不允许商店想什么时候提价就提价了。

sentences.english: Raising price again and again should affect economy and social stability, and make people nervous.
sentences.chinese: 轮番提价势必影响经济和社会稳定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: No mark-up would be charged for the sale of finished goods from the HK Company to T Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 香港公司出售制成品给T有限公司时不会提价。

sentences.english: The price hike brings the price of Marlboros to 7 Turkish Liras from 5 liras.
sentences.chinese: 提价使万宝路的价格从5土耳其里拉增加到7里拉。

sentences.english: If you’ve got the power to raise prices without losing business to a competitor, you’ve got a very good business.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有本事提价还不丢客户，你就是好公司。

sentences.english: The government beat a retreat, canceling the announced rises in food prices.
sentences.chinese: 该政府赶紧收回成命，撤消了业已宣布的食品提价。

sentences.english: Companies from Baoshan Iron & Steel Co. to Starbucks Corp. and McDonald's Corp. have raised prices.
sentences.chinese: 从宝山钢铁到星巴克以及麦当劳，各公司纷纷提价。

definition: to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
to raise or lower the price/price adjustment
wholesale price/to settle an account/to pay a bill
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
(of a price) to fluctuate according to the market/to sell at the market price
property or cash held in reserve/stock
